alert.note: Alert for Orange (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 5:25PM PST until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 745 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 PM PST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Doppler radar and automated rain gauges also indicate areas of heavy rainfall. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.35 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Irvine, Huntington Beach, Garden Grove, western Corona, Orange, Fullerton, Costa Mesa and Mission Viejo. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
